summary.long: Joshua is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
This is what happened after the death of Moses, the servant of the Lord.
The Lord said to Joshua son of Nun, the attendant of Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moses my servant is dead. So prepare to cross the Jordan River that lies in front of you. You and all this people, prepare to go into the land that I am about to give to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given you every place where the sole of your foot has stepped, just as I promised Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Wilderness and from Lebanon to the Great River, the Euphrates River—all the land of the Hittites—as far as the Mediterranean Sea, where the sun sets, this will be your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one will be able to stand against you all the days of your life. Just as I was with Moses, I will be with you. I will not abandon you, and I will not forsake you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be strong and courageous, because you will divide this land among these people, this land which I swore to their fathers that I would give to this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just be strong and very courageous. Be careful to act according to the entire Law which my servant Moses commanded for you. Do not turn from it to the right or to the left, so that you may succeed wherever you go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Book of the Law must never depart from your mouth, and you are to meditate on it day and night, so that you will act faithfully according to everything written in it, because then you will prosper in everything you do, and you will succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be terrified and do not be overwhelmed, because the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua gave this order to the officers of the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go through the camp and give this order to the people: ‘Prepare provisions for yourselves, because within three days you will be crossing over this Jordan to take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving to you as a possession.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the Reubenites and the Gadites and to half of the tribe of Manasseh Joshua said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember the command that Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave you when he said, ‘The Lord your God is granting you rest, and he has given you this land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your wives, your children, and your cattle will stay in the land that Moses gave you east of the Jordan, but you yourselves, all of your strong warriors in their military units, are to cross over ahead of your brothers. You are to help your brothers
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the Lord gives rest to them as he has to you and they too take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving them. Then you may return to the land allotted to you so that you may fully possess the land that Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave to you in the area east of the Jordan, toward the sunrise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they answered Joshua, “Everything that you have commanded us we will do. We will go to any place you send us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as we obeyed Moses in all things, we will likewise obey you. May the Lord your God be with you, just as he was with Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who rebels against your orders and does not obey whatever you command him will be put to death. Just be strong and courageous!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two men from Shittim to be spies. He said, “Go and look over the land and Jericho.” So they set out and came to the house of a woman who was a prostitute. Her name was Rahab. They settled in to spend the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was reported to the king of Jericho: “Some Israelite men came here tonight to spy on the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Jericho sent messengers to Rahab. They said, “Bring out the men who came to you, the ones who came to your house, because they have come to spy on the whole land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the woman had taken the two men and had hidden both of them. So she said, “Yes, the men did come to me, but I did not know where they were from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the gate was about to be shut at dark, the men left. I do not know where the men went. Go after them quickly so you can overtake them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she actually had taken them up to the roof and had concealed them among the stalks of flax that she had spread out on the roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Jericho then went to pursue them along the route to the Jordan that led to the fords. The city gate was closed just after the pursuers had gone out to pursue the spies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before the men lay down, Rahab came up to them on the roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to the men, “I know that the Lord has given you the land. Because of you, terror has fallen upon us, and all the inhabitants of the land are melting in fear before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, we have heard that the Lord dried up the waters of the Red Sea in front of you when you came out of Egypt, and we heard what you did to the two Amorite kings east of the Jordan—to Sihon and to Og. We heard that you devoted them to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We heard, and our hearts melted, and no one’s courage could hold up anymore against you, because the Lord your God is God in the heavens above and on the earth below.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, please swear to me by the Lord that since I have shown kindness to you, you in turn will show kindness to my father’s house. Give me a trustworthy sign
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you will preserve the lives of my father and mother and my brothers and sisters and everyone who belongs to them, and that you will spare our lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men said to her, “If you do not reveal what we are doing, our lives are pledged for your lives, even to the point of death. Then when the Lord gives us the land, we will show mercy and faithfulness to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She let them down through the window with a rope, since her house was built into the city wall, and she was living inside the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to them, “To the hill country! Get moving, so the pursuers do not catch up with you. Hide there for three days until the pursuers return, and then you can go on your way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men said to her, “When we come into the land, we will be free from this oath that you made us swear
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unless you tie this bright red cord in the window through which you let us down, and you gather your father and mother, your brothers, and your father’s entire household into your house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any one of them goes outside the doors of your house, his blood will be on his own head, and we will be free of guilt. Anyone who is with you in the house, his blood will be on our heads if a hand is laid on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you reveal what we are doing, we will be free from the oath that you made us swear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “It will be done just as you have said!” Then she sent them out, and they went away. She tied the bright red cord in the window.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they left, they went up into the hill country and stayed there for three days, until the pursuers had returned. The pursuers had searched for them all along the route, but they found nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then the two men set out to return. After they had come down from the hill country, they crossed the river and came to Joshua son of Nun. They reported to him everything that had happened to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Joshua, “The Lord has without doubt given the entire land into our hands. What’s more, all the inhabitants of the land are melting in fear before us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Joshua had gotten up early in the morning, he and all the Israelites set out from Shittim and arrived at the Jordan. They stayed there until they crossed over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three days the officers went through the camp
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and gave this order to the people: “As soon as you see the priests from the tribe of Levi carrying the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord your God, you are to set out from your position and follow the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But keep a distance between you and the ark—about three thousand feet. Do not get too close to it, so that you can determine which way you should go, because you have never crossed over this way before.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said to the people, “Consecrate yourselves, because tomorrow the Lord will do amazing things among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said to the priests, “Lift up the Ark of the Covenant and pass by in front of the people.” So they lifted up the Ark of the Covenant and went ahead of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Today I will begin to exalt you in the eyes of all Israel so that they will know that just as I was with Moses, so I will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the one who will give this order to the priests carrying the Ark of the Covenant: ‘As soon as you come to the edge of the water of the Jordan, you are to stand still in the Jordan.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to the people of Israel, “Come closer to me and listen to the words of the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said, “This is how you will know that the Living God is among you and that he will most certainly drive out from before you the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Hivites, the Perizzites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, and the Jebusites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord of all the earth is about to cross over the Jordan ahead of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now choose for yourselves twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one man from each tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the soles of the feet of the priests carrying the Ark of the Lord, the Lord of all the earth, come to rest in the waters of the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan flowing down from upstream will be cut off, and they will stand up in one heap.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people set out from their tents to cross the Jordan, and the priests carrying the Ark of the Covenant went ahead of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the priests carrying the ark came to the Jordan, and as soon as their feet dipped into the edge of the water (the Jordan is full and overflows all its banks during all the days of the grain harvest),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the waters flowing down from upstream came to a standstill. The waters piled up in one heap, very far away, at Adam, the town that is next to Zarethan, and the waters flowing down to the Sea of the Arabah, that is, the Salt Sea, were completely cut off. So the people crossed the Jordan opposite Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests carrying the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord stood on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan while all Israel was crossing over on dry ground, until the entire nation had finished crossing the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the whole nation had finished crossing the Jordan, the Lord told Joshua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take twelve men from the people, one man from each tribe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and give them the following orders: ‘Pick up twelve stones from here in the middle of the Jordan, from the place where the feet of the priests are standing securely. Carry them over with you and put them at the place where you will stay tonight.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua called the twelve men whom he had selected from the people of Israel—a man from each tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to them, “Go to the middle of the Jordan in front of the Ark of the Lord your God. There each man is to lift up one stone on his shoulder. The number will correspond to the number of the tribes descended from the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that this may be a sign among you when your children ask in the future, ‘What do these stones mean for you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall respond to them that the waters of the Jordan were cut off in front of the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord. When the ark passed through the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off. These stones will serve as a permanent memorial for the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel did just as Joshua had ordered. They picked up twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan, corresponding to the number of the tribes descended from the sons of Israel, as the Lord had instructed Joshua. They carried the stones over with them to their lodging place and deposited them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua also set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan at the spot where the feet of the priests carrying the Ark of the Covenant had stood. They are there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests who carried the ark remained standing in the middle of the Jordan until everything that the Lord had commanded Joshua to speak to the people had been accomplished, just as Moses had commanded Joshua. The people moved swiftly and completed the crossing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people had finished crossing, the Ark of the Lord and the priests crossed over in the presence of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half tribe of Manasseh, arranged by their military units, had crossed over ahead of the people of Israel, just as Moses had commanded them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: about forty thousand men armed for battle. They crossed over to the plain near Jericho to wage war in the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day the Lord exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel, and they honored him, just as they had honored Moses, all the days of his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the priests who are carrying the Ark of the Testimony that they should come up out of the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua commanded the priests, “Come up out of the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priests carrying the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord came up from the middle of the Jordan, as soon as the soles of their feet reached dry ground, the waters of the Jordan returned to their place, and it overflowed all its banks as before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people came up from the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month and set up camp at Gilgal on the eastern border of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those twelve stones that they had taken from the Jordan, Joshua set up at Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the people of Israel, “When your children in the future ask their fathers, ‘What are these stones?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall teach your children, ‘On dry land Israel crossed over this Jordan.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God dried up the waters of the Jordan in front of you until you crossed over, just as the Lord your God did to the Red Sea, which he dried up in front of us until we had crossed over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did this so that all the peoples of the earth would know that the hand of the Lord is strong, so that you would fear the Lord your God always.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the kings of the Amorites who were in the region west of the Jordan and all the kings of the Canaanites who were by the sea heard that the Lord had dried up the waters of the Jordan in front of the people of Israel until we had crossed over, their hearts melted, and they lost all courage in the presence of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Lord said to Joshua, “Make flint knives, and circumcise the sons of Israel again, a second time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua made flint knives, and he circumcised the sons of Israel at the Hill of the Foreskins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the reason Joshua had to circumcise the men of Israel again: All the people who came up out of Egypt—all the males, the fighting men—died in the wilderness along the way after they came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people who came out of Egypt had been circumcised, but all the people born in the wilderness during the journey after they had come out from Egypt had not been circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, for forty years the Israelites walked through the wilderness until the whole nation was gone—all the fighting men who had gone out from Egypt, who had not listened to the voice of the Lord. The Lord had sworn to them that they would not see the land that the Lord had sworn to their fathers to give us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was their sons, whom the Lord had raised up in their place, whom Joshua circumcised. They were still uncircumcised, since the people had not circumcised them during the journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the whole nation had been circumcised, they stayed at their places in the camp until they recuperated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away the disgrace of Egypt from you.” So the name of that place is Gilgal to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the people of Israel were camped at Gilgal, they celebrated the Passover on the plain near Jericho on the fourteenth day of the month, in the evening at sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ate from the produce of the land on the day after the Passover. On that very day they ate unleavened bread and roasted grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The manna stopped the day after the first day that they had eaten from the produce of the land. The people of Israel no longer received manna. Instead, they ate from the crops of the land of Canaan that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua was at Jericho, he looked up and saw a man was standing right there in front of him with a drawn sword in his hand. Joshua went to him and said, “Are you one of us or one of our enemies?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man said, “Neither! I have now come as the commander of the army of the Lord.” Joshua fell with his face to the ground and worshipped. Then he said to him, “What does my Lord have to say to his servant?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The commander of the army of the Lord said to Joshua, “Take your sandals off your feet, because the place where you are standing is holy.” So Joshua did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jericho was shut up tight because of the Israelites. There was no one going out and no one coming in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Joshua, “See, I have given Jericho and its king into your hands even though they are strong warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall march around the city with all the fighting men. Circle the city one time. Do this for six days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven priests shall carry seven special ram’s horns in front of the ark. On the seventh day you shall march around the city seven times with the priests blowing the ram’s horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When there is a long blast on the special ram’s horn of jubilee, when you hear the sound of the ram’s horn, all the people shall shout with a loud war cry. Then the wall of the city will collapse on itself, and the people will go up into the city, one man after another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua son of Nun called for the priests and said to them, “Lift up the Ark of the Covenant, and seven priests shall carry seven special ram’s horns in front of the Ark of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the people, “Move out. March around the city. The armed contingent shall march in front of the Ark of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua had given orders to the people, the seven priests with the seven special ram’s horns moved forward in front of the Lord, blowing the ram’s horns continuously, with the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord following them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The armed contingent was marching ahead of the priests, who were blowing the ram’s horns, and the rear guard was following the ark. The priests kept blowing the ram’s horns as they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the people Joshua had given the order, “Do not shout and do not let your voice be heard. Do not let a word go out of your mouth until the day I say to you, ‘Shout!’ Then you shall shout!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he had the Ark of the Lord go around the city, sending it out to circle the city one time. Then they came back to the camp and spent the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua got up early in the morning, and the priests lifted up the Ark of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven priests with the seven special ram’s horns moved forward in front of the Ark of the Lord, blowing the ram’s horns continuously. The armed contingent was marching in front of them, and the rear guard was following behind the Ark of the Lord. The priests kept blowing the ram’s horns as they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They marched around the city one time on the second day, and then they returned to the camp. They did this for six days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on the seventh day they got up early, at daybreak, and they marched around the city seven times, following the directions they had been given. It was only on the seventh day that they marched around the city seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on the seventh time, the priests blew the ram’s horns, and Joshua said to the people, “Shout, because the Lord has given you the city!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city will be devoted to destruction. The city and everything in it will be devoted to the Lord. Only Rahab the prostitute will live—she along with all who are with her in the house—because she hid the agents whom we sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must keep away from the things devoted to destruction, or you will make yourselves subject to destruction by taking some of the devoted things, and you will make the camp of Israel subject to destruction and bring disaster upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the silver and gold and the articles of bronze and iron are sacred to the Lord. They must go into the treasury of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people shouted, and the priests blew the ram’s horns. When the people heard the sound of the ram’s horns, they shouted with a loud war cry. Then the wall collapsed on itself, and the people went up into the city, one man after another. So they captured the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they applied the decree of destruction by the edge of the sword to everything that was in the city—both men and women, young and old, and also the oxen, sheep, and donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the two men who had spied on the land Joshua said, “Go to the house of the prostitute and bring out the woman and everyone who belongs to her, just as you swore to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the young men who had acted as spies went and brought out Rahab, her father, her mother, her brothers, and everyone who belonged to her. They brought out all her family members, and they settled them outside the camp of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the city and everything in it they burned with fire. Only the silver and gold and the bronze and iron vessels were placed into the treasury of the House of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joshua spared the lives of Rahab the prostitute and her father’s household and everyone who belonged to her, and she has lived within Israel to this day, because she hid the agents that Joshua sent to spy on Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time Joshua swore an oath:
Cursed before the Lord is the man who sets out to rebuild this city, Jericho.
At the cost of his firstborn he will lay its foundation,
and at the cost of his youngest he will set up its gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord was with Joshua, and his fame spread through the whole land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel acted unfaithfully in regard to the devoted things. Achan the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah, took some of the devoted things, and the anger of the Lord burned against the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is near Beth Aven, east of Bethel. He said to them, “Go up and spy on the land.” So the men went up and spied on Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They returned to Joshua and told him, “All the people do not need to go up. Let about two or three thousand men go up, and they can defeat Ai. Do not trouble all the people with going up there, because there are only a few people in Ai.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So about three thousand men from among the people went up there, but they fled from the men of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Ai struck dead about thirty-six of them. They pursued them from the city gate as far as Shebarim, and they struck them dead on the way down the descent. So the hearts of the people melted and turned to water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua tore his clothes and fell down with his face to the ground in front of the Ark of the Lord until evening—he and the elders of Israel. They also threw dust on their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “Ah, my Lord God! Why did you bring this people across the Jordan to place us into the hand of the Amorites to exterminate us? If only we had been willing to settle in the area on the other side of the Jordan!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please bear with me, my Lord! What can I say after Israel has turned its back before its enemies?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear, and they will surround us and cut off our name from the earth. Then what will you do for your great name?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord gave directions to Joshua:
You, get up! Why are you falling on your face?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel has sinned! They have transgressed the covenant that I commanded for them! Yes, they have even taken some of the devoted things. They have stolen! They have deceived! Yes, they have even placed the devoted things that they stole among their own goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why the people of Israel are not able to stand before their enemies. They turned their backs before their enemies because they have become liable to destruction. I will not continue to be with you unless you destroy the devoted things from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up and consecrate the people. You are to tell them: Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, because this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says. Things devoted to destruction are in your midst, Israel. You will not be able to stand before your enemies until you remove the devoted things from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning you are to present yourselves tribe by tribe. The tribe that the Lord identifies is to come forward by clans. The clan that the Lord identifies is to come forward by households. The household that the Lord identifies is to come forward one man at a time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man who is caught with the devoted things is to be burned with fire—he and all that belongs to him—because he transgressed the covenant of the Lord and because he committed sacrilege in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua got up early in the morning, and he had Israel come forward tribe by tribe. The tribe of Judah was identified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he had the tribe of Judah come forward, and he identified the clan of the Zerahites. Next, he had the clan of the Zerahites come forward by individual families, and Zabdi’s family was identified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he had Zabdi’s household come forward one man at a time, and Achan the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah, was identified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to Achan, “My son, give glory now to the Lord, the God of Israel, and give him praise. Now tell me what you did. Do not conceal it from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Achan answered Joshua, “It is true. I am the one who has sinned against the Lord, the God of Israel, and this is what I did:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among the plunder I saw an expensive Mesopotamian robe, a fine one, and two hundred shekels of silver and one wedge of gold—it weighed fifty shekels. I coveted them and I took them. Now they are hidden in the ground inside my tent, and the silver is underneath it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua sent agents. They ran to the tent, and there it was! The robe was hidden in his tent, and the silver was underneath it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took them from the middle of the tent and brought them to Joshua and to all the people of Israel, where they poured them out before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua took Achan son of Zerah and the silver, the garment, and the wedge of gold, as well as Achan’s sons and his daughters, his ox, his donkey and his flock, and his tent and everything that belonged to him—so all Israel, led by Joshua, brought them up to the Valley of Achor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joshua said, “Why have you brought disaster on us? The Lord will bring disaster on you this day!”
Then all Israel stoned Achan to death. They also burned him and them with fire, and they pelted them with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They erected a large heap of stones over Achan, which remains to this day. Then the Lord turned from the heat of his anger. For that reason the name of that place is called the Valley of Achor to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid. Do not be overwhelmed. Take with you the whole military force and get ready to go up to Ai. You see, I have given the king of Ai into your hand with his people, his city, and his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do to Ai and its king just as you did to Jericho and its king, but its plunder and its livestock you may take as spoils of war for yourselves. Set an ambush for the city on the west side of it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua and the whole military force got ready to go up to Ai. Joshua chose thirty thousand men, strong warriors, and sent them out during the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them, “See to it that you set up an ambush against the city on its west side, not very far from the city. All of you are to be on alert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I and all the people who are with me will approach the city. When the men of Ai come out to face us just as they did the first time, we will flee from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come out after us until we lure them away from the city, because they will say, ‘They are fleeing from us just as they did the first time!’ and we will flee from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are to spring up from the ambush and seize the city, and the Lord your God will give it into your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have taken the city, you are to set the city on fire. According to the word of the Lord you are to act in this way. Look, I have commanded you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua sent them out, and they went to the place for the ambush. They lay hidden on the west side of Ai, between Bethel and Ai. But Joshua spent that night among the people of the main force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua got up early in the morning, and he mustered the people. Then he went up—he and the elders of Israel—leading the main force of the people to Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole military force that was with him went up and advanced. They arrived opposite the city, and they camped north of Ai. The valley was between Joshua and Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had taken about five thousand men and set them as an ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how they positioned the people: The whole army that had come from the camp was north of the city, but the detachment in the ambush was west of the city. That night Joshua went out into the middle of the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the king of Ai saw this, the men of the city got up quickly and went out to face Israel in battle—the king and all his people—at the chosen place facing the Arabah. But he did not know that there was an ambush for him west of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel pretended to be beaten before them and fled toward the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people that were in the city were marshaled to pursue them. As they pursued Joshua, they were lured away from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So not a man was left in Ai or Bethel who did not go out after Israel. They left the city open and pursued Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Point toward Ai with the javelin that is in your hand, because I will give Ai into your hand.” So Joshua reached out toward the city with the javelin that was in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ambush force quickly sprang up from its place and came running as soon as he reached out his hand. Then they went into the city, took it, and quickly set it on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Ai turned to look behind them, and, to their surprise, the smoke of the city was rising to the sky! They were not strong enough to escape this way or that, because the people of Israel who had been fleeing toward the wilderness turned back against the pursuers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush force had taken the city and that smoke was rising from the city, they turned back and struck the men of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the other Israelites came out of the city against the men of Ai so that they were trapped in the middle of Israel, with some Israelites on this side of them and some on that. So Israel struck them down until there was no one left, no survivor, no escapee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they took the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel had finished killing all the inhabitants of Ai who were in the open country of the wilderness, into which the men of Ai had pursued them, and when all of the men of Ai had fallen by the edge of the sword so that they were finished off, then all Israel turned back to Ai and struck it with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who fell that day, both men and women, were twelve thousand—all the people of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua did not lower his hand that held the javelin until he had completely destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the livestock and the plunder from that city the Israelites took as spoils of war for themselves, according to the word of the Lord that he had commanded Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua burned Ai and reduced it to a mound of rubble, which lies in ruins to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hanged the king of Ai on a tree until evening. When the sun was setting, Joshua gave the command, and they took down his corpse from the tree and threw it at the entrance to the gatehouse of the city. Then they erected a large heap of stones over him, which remains to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua built an altar to the Lord, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had commanded the people of Israel. According to the directions written in the Book of the Law of Moses, it was an altar of uncut stones, upon which no one had used an iron tool. They offered up burnt offerings to the Lord on it, and they also sacrificed fellowship offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There on the stones Joshua wrote a copy of the Law of Moses, which he wrote in the presence of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel with its elders and officers and its judges were standing on both sides of the ark facing the priests from the tribe of Levi who held the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord. Both the resident aliens and the native-born stood there, half in front of Mount Gerizim and half in front of Mount Ebal, just as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had commanded previously, so that the people of Israel could be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, Joshua read aloud all the words of the law, the blessing and the curse, exactly as all of it is written in the Book of the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was not one word of all that Moses had commanded that Joshua did not read aloud before the whole assembly of Israel, including the women, the children, and the aliens living among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the kings who were west of the Jordan in the hill country, in the Shephelah, and along the entire coast of the Mediterranean Sea as far as Lebanon (the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites) heard what had happened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they gathered together with one purpose: to wage war against Joshua and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and to Ai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they responded by coming up with a clever scheme: They gathered their provisions as if they were going on a trip. They loaded worn-out sacks on their donkeys and wineskins that were worn-out, split, and mended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put worn-out, patched sandals on their feet, and they put on worn-out clothing. All the bread in their provisions was dried out. It had begun to crumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Joshua at the camp at Gilgal and told him and the men of Israel, “We have come from a land far away. So now, make a treaty with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Israel said to the Hivites, “Perhaps you live among us. How can we make a treaty with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to Joshua, “We are your servants.”
So Joshua said to them, “Who are you, and where do you come from?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Because of the Name of the Lord your God, your servants have come from a land very far away. For we heard the report about him and all that he did in Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites who were in the area east of the Jordan—to Sihon king of Heshbon and to Og king of Bashan, who was in Ashtaroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our elders and all the inhabitants of our land said to us, ‘Take in your hand provisions for the journey and go to meet them. You should say to them, “We are your servants, so now make a treaty with us.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This bread of ours was hot when we packed for the trip at our houses on the day we set out to come to you. Now, look, it is dried out and has become crumbs!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wineskins were new when we filled them. Look, they have burst! Look at our clothing and our sandals. They wore out because of the great length of the journey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men of Israel took some of their provisions, but they did not seek the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua made peace with them. He made a treaty with them to let them live, and the leaders of the community swore an oath to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But three days after they had made the treaty with them, the Israelites heard that they were their neighbors, that is, that they were living among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel set out and came to the Gibeonites’ cities on the third day. Their cities were Gibeon, Kephirah, Be’eroth, and Kiriath Jearim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people of Israel did not attack them because the leaders of the congregation had sworn an oath to them by the Lord, the God of Israel. So the whole community grumbled against the leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the leaders said to the community, “We swore an oath to them by the Lord, the God of Israel, so now we are not able to touch them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what we should do with them: We will keep them alive so that there will not be anger against us because of the oath that we swore to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders said to the community, “They shall live!” So they became wood cutters and water carriers for the whole community, just as the leaders had advised concerning them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua summoned them and said to them, “Why did you deceive us by saying, ‘We live very far away from you,’ when in fact you live right among us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now you are cursed! The name ‘slave’ will never be removed from you. You will always be wood cutters and water carriers for the house of my God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Joshua, “Your servants were told very clearly that the Lord your God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land and to exterminate all the inhabitants of the land from your presence. We feared greatly for our lives because of you. That is why we did this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So here we are, in your hand. Whatever seems good and right in your eyes to do to us, do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that is what he did to them. He saved them from the hand of the people of Israel so that they did not kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Joshua designated them as wood cutters and water carriers for the community and for the altar of the Lord, for the place the Lord would choose, until this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard that Joshua had captured Ai and devoted it to destruction, and that Joshua had done to Ai and its king exactly what he had done to Jericho and its king, and that the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and were allied with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he and those with him were very afraid because Gibeon was a large city, like one of the royal capital cities. It was larger than Ai, and all its men were warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem sent word to Hoham king of Hebron, to Piram king of Jarmuth, to Japhia king of Lachish, and to Debir king of Eglon. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come up, join me, and help me. We must attack Gibeon, because it made peace with Joshua and with the Israelites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the five kings of the Amorites—namely, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon—gathered together and went up with all their divisions. They set up camp around Gibeon and waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Gibeon sent word to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal, saying, “Do not withdraw your hand from your servants. Come up to us quickly! Save us! Help us, because all the kings of the Amorites living in the hill country have united themselves against us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua went up from Gilgal—he and all the military forces with him, including all the strong warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, because I have given them into your hand. Not a man among them will be able to stand in your presence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua came upon them unexpectedly by marching up from Gilgal all night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord threw them into a panic before Israel, and he struck a powerful blow against them at Gibeon. Then he chased them on the road that goes up to Beth Horon, and he struck them as far as Azekah and Makkedah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were fleeing from Israel on the descent from Beth Horon, the Lord hurled large stones from the heavens on them all the way to Azekah. So they died. Those who died from the hailstones were many more than those whom the Israelites killed by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Joshua spoke to the Lord on the day that the Lord gave the Amorites into the power of Israel ⎣when he struck them down at Gibeon, and they were struck down before the people of Israel⎦. He said in the sight of Israel:
Sun, rest at Gibeon.
Moon, rest at the Valley of Aijalon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun rested,
and the moon stood still
until a nation could avenge itself on its enemies.
Is this not written in the Book of Jashar? The sun stood still in the middle of the sky and did not hurry to set for about a whole day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There has never been a day like that day either before it or after it, a day when the Lord listened to the voice of a man, for the Lord was fighting for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him returned to the camp at Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those five kings fled and hid in the cave at Makkedah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was reported to Joshua: “The five kings have been found hiding in the cave at Makkedah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua said, “Roll large stones against the mouth of the cave, and station men over it to guard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you—do not stand still. Chase your enemies and attack them from the rear. Do not give them a chance to get to their cities, because the Lord your God has given them into your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua and the people of Israel had inflicted a devastating blow upon them, to the point that they were almost wiped out (though a small group of survivors escaped into the fortified cities),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then all the people returned safely to the camp of Joshua at Makkedah. No one dared to speak a word against the people of Israel—against any one of them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said, “Open the mouth of the cave, and bring those five kings out to me from the cave.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did so and brought those five kings out to him from the cave: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had brought those kings out to Joshua, he summoned every man of Israel and said to the commanders of the fighting men who had gone with him, “Come, put your feet on the necks of these kings.” So they came and put their feet on their necks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said to them, “Do not be afraid. Do not be overwhelmed. Be strong and courageous because the Lord will do these same things to all your enemies against whom you are waging war.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua struck them down after that, and after he had killed them, he hung them on five trees. They were hung on the trees until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At sunset Joshua gave the command, and they took them down from the trees and threw them into the cave where they had hidden themselves. They placed large stones over the mouth of the cave, which remain there to this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua captured Makkedah on that day and struck it and its king with the edge of the sword. He devoted it to destruction, together with every living thing that was in it. He did not leave a survivor. So he did to the king of Makkedah just as he had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Makkedah to Libnah and waged war against Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave it into the hand of Israel, together with its king. He struck Libnah with the edge of the sword, together with every living thing that was in it. He did not leave a survivor in it. So he did to its king just as he had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Libnah to Lachish. He set up camp against it and waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave Lachish into the hand of Israel. He captured it on the second day, and he struck it with the edge of the sword, together with every living thing that was in it, exactly as he had done to Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish, but Joshua struck him and his people until he did not leave one survivor for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved from Lachish to Eglon. They set up camp against it and waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured it on that day and struck it with the edge of the sword, together with every living thing that was in it. On that day he devoted it to destruction, exactly as he had done to Lachish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him went up from Eglon to Hebron, and they waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured it and struck it with the edge of the sword together with its king and all its settlements and every living thing that was in it. He did not leave a survivor, exactly as he had done to Eglon. He devoted it to destruction, along with every living thing in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next Joshua and all Israel with him turned back to Debir and waged war against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He captured it, together with its king and all its settlements. They struck them with the edge of the sword and devoted to destruction every living thing that was in it. He did not leave a survivor. Just as he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir and its king, just as he had done to Libnah and its king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way Joshua struck the whole land: the hill country, the Negev, the Shephelah, and the slopes, together with all their kings. He did not leave a survivor. Every breathing thing he devoted to destruction, just as the Lord, the God of Israel, had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua struck them from Kadesh Barnea all the way to Gaza and from the whole land of Goshen all the way to Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these kings and their land Joshua captured at one time because the Lord, the God of Israel, was fighting for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him returned to the camp at Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jabin king of Hazor heard what had happened, he sent word to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Akshaph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to the kings in the northern hill country, those in the Arabah south of Kinneret, in the Shephelah, and in Naphoth Dor to the west,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as well as to the Canaanites in the east and the west, and to the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, and the Jebusites in the hill country, and to the Hivites below Mount Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came out—they and all their divisions with them—a people as numerous as the sand on the seashore, together with very many horses and chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these kings gathered together. They came and camped together at the Waters of Merom to wage war against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, because tomorrow at this time I will give all of them to Israel as corpses. You are to hamstring their horses and burn their chariots with fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua and all the military forces with him came upon them suddenly at the Waters of Merom and attacked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave them into the hand of Israel, and they struck them and pursued them as far as Great Sidon, as far as Misrephoth Maim, and as far east as the Valley of Mizpah. They struck them down until they left no survivor for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua did to them just as the Lord had said to him: He hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua turned back at that time and captured Hazor. He struck down its king with the sword, even though Hazor had formerly been the head of all these kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites struck down every living thing that was in Hazor with the edge of the sword, devoting them to destruction. He left nothing breathing, and Hazor he burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua captured all the cities of these kings and all their kings. He struck them with the edge of the sword. He devoted them to destruction just as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But none of the cities standing on their mounds were burned by Israel—except that Joshua did burn Hazor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the plunder from these cities, including the cattle, was taken by the people of Israel as spoils of war for themselves, but they struck down every person with the edge of the sword until they had exterminated them all. They did not leave anything that breathed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the Lord had commanded his servant Moses, so Moses commanded Joshua, and so Joshua did. He did not fail to carry out a single word of everything that the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua took all this land: the hill country, all the Negev, all the land of Goshen, the Shephelah, the Arabah, the mountainous region of Israel and its foothills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Mount Halak that rises to Seir, as far as Baal Gad in the Valley of Lebanon under Mount Hermon. He captured all their kings. He struck them and put them to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many days Joshua made war with all these kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was no city that made peace with the people of Israel except for the Hivites living in Gibeon. The Israelites took them all in battle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it was the Lord who hardened their hearts so that they would confront Israel in battle and would be devoted to destruction, and they would not receive mercy but would be destroyed, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Joshua went and cut off the Anakites from the hill country—from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the hill country of Judah and from all the hill country of Israel. Joshua devoted them and their cities to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were no Anakites remaining in the land of the Israelites. Only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod were they left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua took the whole land according to everything the Lord had spoken to Moses, and Joshua gave it as an inheritance to Israel according to their allotments for their tribes. Then the land rested from war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following are the kings of the land whom the people of Israel struck down and then took possession of their land, which was east of the Jordan toward the rising of the sun, from the Arnon Canyon to Mount Hermon, including all of the Arabah east of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first was Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon. He ruled over the territory that extends from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Arnon Canyon, and from the middle of the canyon all the way north to the Jabbok Canyon, which is the border of the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This includes half of Gilead. He also ruled over the eastern part of the Arabah from the Sea of Kinneret south as far as the Sea of the Arabah, which is the Salt Sea, and east in the direction of Beth Jeshimoth and south as far as the slopes of Pisgah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second area was the territory of Og king of Bashan, who was from a remnant of the Rephaim and who lived in Ashtaroth and in Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was ruler in Mount Hermon, in Salekah, and in all Bashan up to the border of the Geshurites and the Ma’akathites, and in half of Gilead as far south as the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses, the servant of the Lord, and the people of Israel struck them down. Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave this land east of the Jordan as a possession to the tribe of Reuben, to the tribe of Gad, and to the half tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following are the kings of the land that Joshua and the people of Israel struck down in the area west of the Jordan, from Baal Gad in the Valley of Lebanon to Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir. Joshua gave it to the tribes of Israel as a possession according to their allotments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which were in the hill country, in the Shephelah, in the Arabah, on the slopes, in the wilderness, and in the Negev—land that formerly was the land of the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Jericho onethe king of Ai, which is next to Bethel one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Jerusalem onethe king of Hebron one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Jarmuth onethe king of Lachish one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Eglon onethe king of Gezer one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Debir onethe king of Geder one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Hormah onethe king of Arad one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Libnah onethe king of Adullam one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Makkedah onethe king of Bethel one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Tappuah onethe king of Hepher one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Aphek onethe king for the Sharon Plain one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Madon onethe king of Hazor one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Shimron Meron onethe king of Akshaph one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Ta’anach onethe king of Megiddo one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Kedesh onethe king of Jokneam in Carmel one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Dor in Naphoth Dor onethe king of Goyim in Gilgal one
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Tirzah oneall of the kings thirty-one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua had grown old and had advanced in years. So the Lord said to him, “You have grown old and advanced in years, but very much land remains to be taken as your possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is the land that remains:
All the districts of the Philistines and all of the Geshurites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the Shihor, which is east of Egypt, to the border of Ekron on the north. (This is reckoned as belonging to the Canaanites, but includes the five serens of the Philistines, the serens of Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron, as well as the Avvites
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
on the south.)
All the land of the Canaanites, and Me’arah, which belongs to the Sidonians, as far as Aphek, up to the border of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land of the Gebalites, and all of Lebanon toward the rising of the sun, from Baal Gad below Mount Hermon up to the entry to Hamath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon to Misrephoth Maim, and all the Sidonians.
“I myself will drive them out as the people of Israel advance. So assign the land to Israel as their possession by lot, just as I have commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now apportion this land as an inheritance for nine of the tribes and one of the half tribes of Manasseh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Together with the other half tribe of Manasseh, the Reubenites and Gadites had already received their inheritance from Moses in the area east of the Jordan, just as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had assigned it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It extended from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Arnon Canyon, and from the city that is in the middle of the canyon, and included all the tableland from Medeba to Dibon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It included all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon, up to the border of the people of Ammon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Gilead, and the territory of the Geshurites and the Ma’akathites, and all Mount Hermon and all of Bashan to Salekah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
also all the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who ruled in Ashtaroth and in Edrei.
(Og himself was left from the remnant of the Rephaim, and Moses struck them down and drove them out.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people of Israel did not drive out the Geshurites and the Ma’akathites. So Geshur and Ma’akath have lived within Israel to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the tribe of Levi, Moses did not give an inheritance. Their inheritance is the offerings made by fire to the Lord, the God of Israel, just as he said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave land to the tribe of the descendants of Reuben according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory included Aroer, which is on the edge of the Arnon Canyon, and the city that is in the middle of the canyon, and all of the tableland by Medeba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It included Heshbon and all its cities that are in the tableland, also Dibon, Bamoth Baal, and Beth Baal Meon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Jahaz, Kedemoth, and Mepha’ath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Kiriathaim, and Sibmah, and Zereth Shahar on the hill in the valley,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Beth Peor, and the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth Jeshimoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all the cities of the tableland.
It included the whole kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon, whom Moses had struck down, together with the chiefs of Midian, namely, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who were subject kings under Sihon and lived in his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition to the Midianites who were killed, the Israelites killed with the sword Balaam son of Beor, who practiced divination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of the descendants of Reuben was the Jordan River. This was the border of the inheritance of the descendants of Reuben according to their clans—the cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses also gave land to the tribe of Gad, to the descendants of Gad according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory included Jazer, and all the cities of Gilead, and half of the land of the descendants of Ammon, as far as Aroer, which is near Rabbah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also it extended from Heshbon to Ramat Hamizpah and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also in the valley he gave them Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, and Succoth, as well as Zaphon, and the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, with the Jordan as a border, up to the end of the Sea of Galilee, the region beyond the Jordan to the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the descendants of Gad according to their clans—the cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses also gave land to the half tribe of Manasseh. It was given to the half tribe of the descendants of Manasseh according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory extended from Mahanaim through all of Bashan, including all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan and all the tent villages of Jair, which are in Bashan—sixty cities in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave half of Gilead, also Ashtaroth and Edrei, cities belonging to the kingdom of Og in Bashan, to the descendants of Makir, the son of Manasseh, to half of the descendants of Makir according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These territories are what Moses had given as an inheritance while in the Plains of Moab from the region beyond the Jordan of Jericho to the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the tribe of Levi, Moses had not given an inheritance. The Lord, the God of Israel—he is their inheritance, as he had said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following are the allotted inheritances for the descendants of Israel in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leading fathers of the tribes allotted as an inheritance to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The inheritances for nine tribes and the half tribe of Manasseh were determined by lot, just as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses had already assigned inheritances to two tribes and to one half tribe in the region east of the Jordan, but to the Levites he did not give an inheritance among the other tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the sons of Joseph had been divided into two tribes, namely, Manasseh and Ephraim, the Levites did not receive a tribal territory in the land. They did, however, receive cities to live in along with the cities’ pasturelands for their cattle and property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the Lord had commanded Moses, that is what the people of Israel did when they apportioned the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the people of Judah came to Joshua at Gilgal, Caleb son of Jephunneh, the Kenizzite, said this to him:
You know what the Lord spoke to Moses, the man of God, concerning you and me in Kadesh Barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was forty years old when Moses, the servant of the Lord, sent me from Kadesh Barnea to scout the land, and I brought back to him my heartfelt advice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When my brother Israelites who went up with me made the hearts of the people melt, I nevertheless fully followed the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses swore an oath to me on that day. He said, “Most certainly the land on which your foot has walked shall be an inheritance for you and for your children forever, because you fully followed the Lord my God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now as you see, the Lord has kept me alive, just as he said, for these forty-five years since the Lord spoke this promise to Moses when Israel was traveling in the wilderness. So now, here I am today, eighty-five years old!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am still as strong today as on the day that Moses sent me out. My strength for going out and for coming back from battle is the same now as it was then.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, give me this place in the hill country that the Lord promised that day. Even though you heard on that day that the Anakites are there, as well as large fortified cities, perhaps the Lord will be with me, and I will drive them out, just as the Lord said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua blessed him, and he gave Hebron to Caleb son of Jephunneh as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Hebron has belonged to Caleb son of Jephunneh, the Kenizzite, as an inheritance to this day, because he fully followed after the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The name of Hebron formerly was Kiriath Arba. Arba was the greatest man among the Anakites.
So the land rested from war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the allotment for the tribe of the descendants of Judah according to their clans. It extended south to the border with Edom and through the Negev to the Wilderness of Zin in the extreme south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border on the south started from the south end of the Dead Sea, from the bay that faces south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It goes south from the Ascent of Akrabbim and crosses over to Zin and ascends from south of Kadesh Barnea.
Then it crosses over to Hezron and ascends to Adar and curves around to Karka.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then it crosses over to Azmon and goes out to the Stream of Egypt.
The border ends at the Mediterranean Sea.
This is your southern border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The border on the east is the Dead Sea, up to the mouth of the Jordan.
The border on the north side starts from the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The border ascends to Beth Hoglah and crosses over north of Beth Arabah.
Then the border ascends to the Stone of Bohan, the son of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the border ascends to Debir from the Valley of Achor and turns north toward Gilgal, which is opposite the Ascent of Adummim, which is south of the streambed.
Then the border crosses over to the waters of En Shemesh, ending at En Rogel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the border ascends through the Valley of the Son of Hinnom at the slope of the Jebusites on the south side of Jerusalem.
Then the border ascends to the top of the mountain that is across the Valley of Hinnom on the west side, where Hinnom meets the north end of the Valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the border bends from the top of the mountain to the spring of the Waters of Nephtoah and goes out to the cities of Mount Ephron.
Then the border bends toward Baalah—that is, Kiriath Jearim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border curves around from Baalah westward to Mount Seir and crosses over to the slope of Mount Jearim from the north—that is, Kesalon—and descends to Beth Shemesh, then crosses over to Timnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The border goes out to the slope of Ekron, on the north.
Then the border bends to Shikkeron and crosses over Mount Baalah and goes out to Jabne’el, and the border ends at the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The border on the west—the Mediterranean Sea is the border.
This is the border on all sides for the descendants of Judah according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Caleb son of Jephunneh, Joshua gave a portion among the people of Judah, in keeping with the word of the Lord to Joshua, namely, the city of Kiriath Arba (Arba was the father of Anak). Kiriath Arba is now called Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb drove out from there the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went up from there against the inhabitants of Debir. The name of Debir was formerly Kiriath Sepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb said, “If anyone attacks Kiriath Sepher and captures it, I will give my daughter Aksah to him as his wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Othniel son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, captured Kiriath Sepher, and Caleb gave his daughter Aksah to him as his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she came to Othniel, she pressured him to ask her father for some pastureland. As she dismounted from the donkey, Caleb said to her, “What do you want?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “Give me a blessing. Since you have given me land in the dry Negev, you should also give me springs of water.” So he gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the people of Judah according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cities at the southern edge of the tribe of the people of Judah along the border with Edom in the Negev are:
Kabze’el, Eder, Jagur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazor Hadattah, Kerioth Hezron (that is, Hazor),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Pelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Shual, Beersheba, Biziothiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baalah, Iyim, Ezem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltolad, Kesil, Hormah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon—twenty-nine cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the Shephelah the cities are:
Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jarmuth, Adullam, Sokoh, Azekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sha’araim, Adithaim, Gederah, and Gederothaim—fourteen cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dilan, Mizpah, Jokthe’el,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kabbon, Lahmas, Kitlish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Na’amah, and Makkedah—sixteen cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keilah, Akzib, and Mareshah—nine cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ekron and its surrounding towns and its villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: West of Ekron, all the towns that are near Ashdod and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also Ashdod with its surrounding towns and its villages.
Gaza with its surrounding towns and its villages, as far as the Stream of Egypt, with the Mediterranean Sea as the boundary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the hill country the cities were:
Shamir, Jattir, Sokoh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dannah, Kiriath Sannah (that is, Debir),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh—eleven cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arab, Rumah, Eshan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Janum, Beth Tappuah, Aphekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humtah, Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron), and Zior—nine cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jezre’el, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah—ten cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Halhul, Beth Zur, Gedor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ma’arath, Beth Anoth, and Eltekon—six cities and their villages.
⎣Tekoa, Ephrathah (that is, Bethlehem), Peor, Etam, Kolan, Tatem, Shoresh, Kerem, Gallim, Bether and Manoko—eleven cities and their villages.⎦
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kiriath Baal (that is, Kiriath Jearim) and Rabbah—two cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the wilderness:
Beth Arabah, Middin, Sekakah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nibshan, Ir Melah, and En Gedi—six cities and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for the Jebusites, who were the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the people of Judah were not able to drive them out. The Jebusites have lived with the people of Judah in Jerusalem to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator
